title: Pasting a copied image always raises the brightness
content: For the past couple years, whenever I use the copy image feature the pasted outcome is always minimally brightened just enough that it's noticeable. Copying and pasting of the outcome brightens it again, and if I keep going the resulting image will be one big white square. This isn't the end of the world, more of an inconvenience as all I've had to do is switch to taking a screenshot of the image instead, but I do miss being able to just properly copy the image. The brightened effect is present no matter where I paste it, whether on another website or on a completely separate app, and other browsers I've tried on the same Mac don't have this problem. Is there a way for me to fix this? I already followed the support instructions for a different yet somewhat related pasting problem where I set gfx.color_management.mode to 0, and that had no effect. Is there anything else?

title: CTRL+Shift+P to open Private Window not working.
content:
Windows 11 23H2 - Firefox 131.0.3

I use firefox on laptop with a usb keyboard, On the laptop CTRL+Shift+P using Left CTRL+Shift+P and Right CTRL+Shift+P works as intended and opens a private window.

However on the usb keyboard using the Left CTRL+Shift+P doesn't work to open a private window while the Right CTRL+Shift+P works normally.

After a bit of trial and error i worked out the issue with the usb keyboard is the left CTRL key. It works for other shortcuts such as CTRL P but just not for the new private window command.

I tried loading firefox in troubleshoot mode to see if this was an addon issue, still no good. Tried 2 different keyboards from the one i use daily just to see what would happen and still the same issue.

Any suggestions? im at a loss.
creator: Diatzen

title: The background color of the new tab page replaces the one used by some websites.
content:

Here's what I see (see the firsrt attached screenshot). Now, if I open the same URL in Private browsing, the background color changes too (see the second screeenshot). In the 3rd screenshot I'm adding the reference rendering, that's how I expect this website to render (Edge).

In the screenshot 1 and 2, the background color is exactly the same as the one used by the new tab page when I open a new tab.

Questions: 1) Why is that? 2) Can I change that?

Context: I'm trying to switch to Firefox (from Edge)

title: Firefox is not responding to any commands in the upper area of the command line
content:
Firefox is not accepting any addresses:

Hello, I have the following problem.

First, Firefox wouldn't start at all. Then I undertook the following repair attempts:

Uninstalled and reinstalled Firefox, keeping the profiles during installation - still won't start. Uninstalled and reinstalled Firefox, not keeping the profiles during installation - still won't start. Uninstalled Firefox and deleted the entire AppData\Roaming\Mozilla folder (backed up first) - it starts. I have always uninstalled via the Windows Control Panel and downloaded (multiple times) and installed the latest version of Mozilla.

Now Firefox is not accepting any addresses. Additionally, it doesn't respond to any commands in the upper area: plugins, settings, etc. do not respond when clicked.

I uninstalled Bitdefender and also turned off the firewall, but it didn't help. I don't know what to do anymore. Can someone please help me?

Specifications:

Processor: Intel(R) Xeon(R) CPU E31245 @ 3.30GHz RAM: 16.0 GB System Type: 64 Bit Windows 10 Pro Version: 22H2 OS Build: 19045.5011
creator: r.weber3

title: Firefox WebRTC - AEC3
content:
Hi All,

I've been working on an issue with one of my customers. They've reported poor audio quality and we narrowed down the issue to most likely being: https://issues.webrtc.org/issues/42220269

We've been trying to find out if Firefox will or would exhibit the same issues. However, when I dug into this it appears Firefox utilizes a forked implementation of webrtc.org and it's not clear how closely coupled if at all the Firefox WebRTC implementation is to webrtc.org.

Our issue is related to AEC3 (Echo canceller algorithm) I can't quite figure out if AEC3 is leveraged by Firefox or not.

Would someone be able to help me confirm how close the implementation of webrtc matches webrtc.org and whether or not AEC3 is implemented?

Thanks!
creator: jchinyou

title: Browsing History or lost Tabs Help
content:
Hello, I've gone through numerous posts on recovering browsing history and tabs in Firefox, but nothing has worked so far. I had two Firefox windows open with over 80 tabs (I know, not ideal!), but I manage several businesses and had important data in those tabs that I really can't afford to lose.

I’m looking for a Firefox expert who can help me recover my old tabs and browsing history, but I haven’t been able to find any paid experts. I’m using a Mac, and unfortunately, my Time Machine wasn’t backed up, so that's not an option.

I’ve already checked under the profiles and tried everything I could find, but is there a way to recover corrupted or deleted files? For context, Firefox stopped working properly (I think I messed it up while trying to fix it)—it would open but remain unresponsive—so I had to reinstall a fresh version. Is there any hope of recovering my history, and where can I find an expert to assist with this?

title: Firefox as PDF Viewer:Ctrl + Mousewheel zoom intermittently doesn't work
content:
I use Firefox as my default PDF Viewer. However recently the Ctrl + Scroll wheel doesn't zoom in and out on PDFs intermittently. It always works on web pages, and Ctrl + +/- works to zoom every time.

I've seen a few times this has been brought up on various forums when googling, but none with a real solution.

It is not specific to a PDF file, I've had it work and then not work in the same file in the same session, and the same behavior in many PDF files. I believe this to be a Firefox issue, not anything related to my setup.

Windows 10 Firefox 131.0.3 (64-bit) Default settings

title: Tree folder - problem drop and dragging e-mails from folder to folder
content:
I have several e-mail accounts active and all have a tree folder structure so that I can categories customers by letter then surname.

Incoming emails are sent to inbox and once dealt with I drag and drop them into their customer folder.

The set up has worked well for many years.

HOWEVER I have (only) one account where this activity has suddenly stop being available. When I drag and drop an e-mail from the inbox folder to another folder seconds later it just bounces back to the inbox. I have deleted the e-mail account and re-instated it and checked for latest updates etc rebooted etc I have no add-ons running.

The account and its associated folders are quite large ! Andy ideas ?

title: Can no longer log in to Coventry Building Society - but more than that...
content:
The security sequence for log-in is supply of user-id and then password; that works fine; then a send unique code dialogue pops up and it leads to an error screen which I am attaching. I have rung the number provided and they say they don't support Firefox; so that looks like end of Firefox use to me and goodbye (can't find a tearful emoji to insert).

Gotta say this kind of thing is happening quite frequently for me; mostly without a nice error screen like this one; last one I recall was hunting for car insurance; on the screen where it listed the billions of quotes to eager providers none of the links to click through for the quotes worked... and with this happeneing more frequently now you go... ohh it's firefox again isn't it... so you reluctantly fire up Google Chrome and of course it works OK.

So I'm kinda here with a broader outlook than just this specific problem; I really am on the verge of giving up with Firefox; it should just work shouldn't it; and it increasingly doesn't anymore; I don't want to get into an extended and convoluted dialogue to help you cure this issue; I'm simply perplexed that some really basic stuff doesn't work anymore; however; I've used Firefox for centuries so thought I should give you at least a chance so I could declare how I feel etc.

I am up for a dialogue over this and hoping this is an easy fix; but; as I say; I'm confused as to why, for me, Firefox just simply doesn't work well anymore; it just should and I shouldn't be here.

title: Mozilla Firefox ESR 115.16.1
content: I'm an IT support professional and in our environment we are still running few servers (for multiple reasons) with OS version Microsoft Windows Server 2012 R2 Standard and Microsoft Windows Server 2012 R2 Datacenter and they have currently Mozilla Firefox ESR (x64 en-US) 115.15.0 installed. I couldn't find any clear answer, hence I've created this ticket - is Mozilla Firefox ESR 115.16.0 supported on this OS ? - usually you are not referring to Microsoft Windows Server in you release notes info - f.ex. https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/115.16.1/system-requirements/ so I need clear answer. Also I cannot download Mozilla Firefox 115.16.1 from https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/115.16.1/releasenotes/ - if I click download it always downloads Mozilla Firefox 128 instead. So please let me know if there is any Mozilla supported version for Microsoft Windows Server 2012. Best Regards, Milosz Wrzalek
creator: mwr104

title: security warning from my Company's IT Department
content:
hi, I assumed that I am allowed to use your latest version of Firefox browser at my work but have received company's email (not spam) today: 

<<Please note you’ve been detected as being the user of a device running the Firefox browser. There have recently been critical vulnerabilities announced, and all versions of this software must be removed or updated to remediate these.

Please note Firefox is not "_ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ " approved software (both Edge and Chrome are supplied as standard), and unless there is a critical business reason (i.e. developing software that has to be tested on the Firefox browser) the software must be removed. The vulnerabilities in this software are of the highest severity, and if not remediated, devices will be isolated from the corporate network for protective purposes. If you require assistance removing, or updating this software please contact the IT Service Desk. Regards, _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _>> I don't like and never did using Edge or Chrome but now it seems I have no choice, unless Firefox improves its security critical vulnerabilities. Could you advise please if you have any alternative solution for me, and many others like me, or maybe there is more secured or light versions of Firefox available.

Kind Regards tank_t54@tuta.io

title: Account Login Very Strange Behavior
content:
I recently updated to Firefox 131.0.3, having signed out of my Firefox/Mozilla account. Now I am trying to sign back in. After a seemingly successful sign-in (with email and pw, followed by "authorization code"), I'm taken to my account page. Scrolling down to Connected Services, I can see a recognizable account name (my Windows 11 user name and the name I've assigned to my computer). But looking up at the account button at the top right of Firefox, I see a small yellow triangle. Clicking on the button, I'm told "Account disconnected." (Remember, I'm currently looking at my account page, which says I'm connected.)

So I try to log in again. I give email address and password, and authorization code, and I'm in again. Now I see an addtional account connected, "Firefox 131, Windows 10" (remember, I'm using Windows 11).

So looking up again to the upper right at the account button, I see the yellow triangle, and clicking tells me once more that I'm disconnected, even though I have my account page open in front of me.

All of this, of course, prevents me from having access to the sync function. I've been through this circle several times with the same strange results.

Anyone have any idea what' going on.

Screenshot attached.

Thanks! Lance
creator: LNEL108
